newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mazda plans output on two extra days.
newsitem.headline: Mazda plans output on two extra days.

text.p: Mazda Motor Corp will operate its Ujina No.1 plant in Hiroshima, western Japan, for an extra two days in September to raise production of its new Demio recreational vehicle, a Mazda spokesman said Wednesday.
The Ujina plant had halted production for two days in May, five days in June, and four days in July, to adjust inventories due to poor domestic sales of its cars.

Mazda, owned 33.4 percent by Ford Motor Co, had launched Demio in Japan last Monday with an initial sales target of 5,000 per month. The Ujina plant produces Familia, MPV, Eunos Roadster, Festiva, Sentia, Bongo Friendee and Demio models.
